caption: Table 3e - A05: Injection Coverage by AWS Security Agent*
note: * The evaluation was conducted against a sample simplified applications with known vulnerabilities. As a result, additional weaknesses or architectural limitations commonly observed in real-world, large-scale applications may not be represented. Analysis of such scenarios is outside the scope of this research.
rows: CWE-103: Struts: Incomplete validate() Method Definition
Not Tested
Description: This vulnerability is Struts framework-specific. Evidence: The tested applications do not use Struts framework, making this vulnerability not applicable. Limitations:
CWE-104: Struts: Form Bean Does Not Extend Validation Class
Not Tested
Description: This vulnerability is Struts framework-specific. Evidence: The tested applications do not use Struts framework, making this vulnerability not applicable. Limitations:
CWE-112: Missing XML Validation
Covered

Description: The service includes XML validation testing through XML external entity (XXE) injection testing. Evidence: Penetration test action groups demonstrate XXE injection vulnerability testing. XXE testing validates XML parsing and validation mechanisms.
CWE-113: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')
Not Covered

Description: The service does not include dedicated HTTP request/response splitting testing in its standard testing scope. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed no HTTP request/response splitting testing was performed. This vulnerability requires specific proxy/server chain configurations not typically present in standard web applications. Limitations: HTTP request/response splitting testing is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-114: Process Control
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects process control vulnerabilities through dedicated command injection testing that validates full system-level process execution control. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate process control detection through remote code execution via command injection with confirmed root-level execution.
CWE-115: Misinterpretation of Input
Covered

Description: The service detects misinterpretation of input through comprehensive injection testing that identifies where user-supplied data is incorrectly interpreted. Evidence: Injection testing across multiple penetration test runs identifies misinterpretation of input where user input is incorrectly interpreted as commands, queries, or code.
CWE-116: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
Covered

Description: The service detects improper encoding or escaping of output through XSS testing and comprehensive injection vulnerability assessment. Evidence: XSS action groups test for improper encoding or escaping of output across multiple penetration test runs.
CWE-129: Improper Validation of Array Index
Not Tested

Description: This vulnerability is primarily applicable to C/C++ and similar languages with manual memory management and direct array access. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed this is a language-specific vulnerability. The tested applications use safe dictionary access patterns rather than unsafe array indexing. Limitations:
CWE-159: Improper Handling of Invalid Use of Special Elements
Covered

Description: The service detects improper handling of special elements through comprehensive injection testing that validates how applications handle special characters and injection payloads. Evidence: All injection action groups test for improper handling of special elements across different contexts.
CWE-20: Improper Input Validation
Covered

Description: The service detects improper input validation through comprehensive injection testing across multiple penetration test runs. Evidence: All injection action groups systematically test for lack of input validation by attempting various injection vectors.
CWE-470: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection')
Covered

Description: The service detects unsafe reflection through code injection testing that identifies where user input is used to dynamically select or execute code. Evidence: Code injection action groups test for unsafe reflection vulnerabilities where externally-controlled input is used to select classes or code.
CWE-493: Critical Public Variable Without Final Modifier
Not Covered

Description: This vulnerability requires static code analysis of source code to identify public variables without final modifiers. Evidence: The tool focuses on runtime penetration testing rather than comprehensive static code analysis of variable modifiers. Limitations: Detailed static code analysis of variable modifiers is not part of the testing scope [UL-008].
CWE-500: Public Static Field Not Marked Final
Not Covered

Description: This vulnerability requires static code analysis of source code to identify public static fields without final modifiers. Evidence: The tool's code scanner focuses on important flows rather than comprehensive field modifier analysis. Limitations: Comprehensive static code analysis of field modifiers is not part of the testing scope [UL-008].
CWE-564: SQL Injection: Hibernate
Covered

Description: The service detects SQL injection vulnerabilities regardless of the underlying ORM or database framework. Evidence: SQL injection action groups test for SQL injection vulnerabilities including Hibernate-specific SQL injection.
CWE-610: Externally Controlled Reference to a Resource in Another Sphere
Covered

Description: The service detects externally controlled resource references through comprehensive injection testing that identifies where user input controls resource access. Evidence: Resource injection testing is covered through various injection action groups including command injection and XXE testing.
CWE-643: Improper Neutralization of Data within XPath Expressions ('XPath Injection')
Not Tested

Description: This vulnerability requires XPath query processing in the application for XML data access. Evidence: The tested applications process XML but do not use XPath queries, making this vulnerability not applicable. Limitations:
CWE-644: Improper Neutralization of HTTP Headers for Scripting Syntax
Covered

Description: The service may detect improper neutralization of HTTP headers through comprehensive injection testing. Evidence: Injection testing across multiple penetration test runs includes HTTP header manipulation testing.
CWE-74: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
Covered

Description: The service includes comprehensive injection testing across multiple injection types that systematically test for improper neutralization of special elements. Evidence: Injection action groups across multiple penetration test runs test for improper neutralization of special elements across different injection types.
CWE-76: Improper Neutralization of Equivalent Special Elements
Covered

Description: The service detects improper neutralization of equivalent special elements through comprehensive injection testing that attempts various encoding and obfuscation techniques. Evidence: All injection action groups test for improper neutralization of special elements including equivalent representations across different injection types.
CWE-77: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
Covered

Description: The service includes dedicated command injection testing action groups that systematically test for command injection vulnerabilities. Evidence: Command injection action groups across multiple penetration test runs demonstrate comprehensive command injection vulnerability assessment.
CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects OS command injection through dedicated command injection testing. Evidence: Command injection testing demonstrates comprehensive OS command injection testing including system command execution and privilege verification.
CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
Covered

Description: The service includes dedicated XSS testing action groups that systematically test for cross-site scripting vulnerabilities. Evidence: XSS action groups are present across multiple penetration test runs, confirming comprehensive XSS detection capabilities.
CWE-80: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in a Web Page (Basic XSS)
Covered
Description: Basic XSS is tested as part of the comprehensive XSS testing capabilities. Evidence: XSS action groups test for basic XSS vulnerabilities as part of comprehensive XSS testing.
CWE-83: Improper Neutralization of Script in Attributes in a Web Page
Covered

Description: Script injection in attributes is tested as part of the comprehensive XSS testing capabilities. Evidence: XSS action groups test for script injection in attributes as part of comprehensive XSS testing.
CWE-86: Improper Neutralization of Invalid Characters in Identifiers in Web Pages
Covered

Description: The service tests identifier-based injection through SQL injection and insecure direct object reference (IDOR) testing. Evidence: Penetration test action groups demonstrate identifier-based injection testing through SQL injection and IDOR tests across multiple applications.
CWE-88: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')
Partial

Description: The service may detect argument injection through command injection testing, but explicit testing for improper neutralization of argument delimiters is not systematically performed. Evidence: Command injection action groups test for command injection but may not explicitly test for argument delimiter injection. Limitations: Explicit testing for improper neutralization of argument delimiters is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
Covered

Description: The service includes dedicated SQL injection testing action groups that systematically test for SQL injection vulnerabilities. Evidence: SQL injection action groups across multiple penetration test runs demonstrate comprehensive SQL injection vulnerability assessment.
CWE-90: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an LDAP Query ('LDAP Injection')
Not Tested

Description: This vulnerability requires LDAP usage in the application for authentication or directory services. Evidence: The tested applications do not use LDAP, making this vulnerability not applicable to the tested applications. Limitations:
CWE-91: XML Injection (aka Blind XPath Injection)
Not Tested

Description: This vulnerability requires XPath query processing in the application for XML data access. Evidence: The tested applications process XML but do not use XPath queries, making this vulnerability not applicable. Limitations:
CWE-917: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an Expression Language Statement ('Expression Language Injection')
Covered

Description: The service successfully detects expression language injection through dedicated Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) testing, which is functionally equivalent to expression language injection. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate SSTI/expression language injection detection with remote code execution capability. SSTI is the expression language injection equivalent for template engines.
CWE-93: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences ('CRLF Injection')
Not Covered

Description: The service does not include CRLF injection testing in its standard testing scope. Evidence: Extended penetration testing confirmed no CRLF injection testing was performed. HTTP header injection patterns were not tested. CRLF injection requires specialized endpoint patterns for header injection attacks. Limitations: CRLF injection testing is not performed [UL-007].
CWE-94: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
Covered

Description: The service includes dedicated code injection testing action groups that systematically test for code injection vulnerabilities. Evidence: Code injection action groups are present across multiple penetration test runs, confirming robust code injection detection capabilities.
CWE-95: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')
Covered

Description: The service detects eval injection through code injection testing that identifies where user input is used in dynamically evaluated code contexts. Evidence: Code injection action groups test for eval injection vulnerabilities where user input is used in dynamically evaluated code.
CWE-96: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Statically Saved Code ('Static Code Injection')
Covered

Description: The service detects static code injection through code injection and template injection testing. Evidence: Code injection and server-side template injection action groups test for static code injection vulnerabilities.
CWE-97: Improper Neutralization of Server-Side Includes (SSI) Within a Web Page
Not Tested

Description: This vulnerability requires Server-Side Includes usage in the application. Evidence: The tested applications use template engines rather than SSI directives, making this vulnerability not applicable. Limitations:
CWE-98: Improper Control of Filename for Include/Require Statement in PHP Program ('PHP Remote File Inclusion')
Partial

Description: The service includes local file inclusion testing but does not explicitly test for PHP remote file inclusion. Evidence: Local file inclusion action groups exist across multiple penetration test runs but focus on local file access rather than remote file inclusion. Limitations: Explicit PHP remote file inclusion testing is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-99: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')
Covered

Description: The service detects resource injection through comprehensive injection testing that identifies where user input controls resource identifiers. Evidence: Resource injection is tested through various injection action groups including command injection and XXE testing.
